slogan: The most convenient way to measure the accuracy of your mechanical watch
delete-watch-confirm: Do you want to delete your
delete-pending-measure-confirm: Do you want to delete your pending measure ?
measure-instructions-part-1: Press this button when the second hand
measure-instructions-part-2: reaches exactly the twelve o'clock position
sync: Synchronizing with the U.S navy atomic clock
sync-confirm-action: All good, take me home scotty
plus-minus-explain: One does not simply have a timepiece without drift! Press the following buttons to add/retrieve a minute.
12-hours-explain: In order for the measure to be precise, you must wait at least 12 hours before checking back your measure. Don't worry, we will send you an email to remind you. In the meantime, enjoy wearing your timepiece !
share-text: My watch is more accurate than {X}% of all tested watches on @ToolwatchApp
share-result: DON'T KEEP THIS GOLDMINE JUST FOR YOU, SHARE IT ;)
about-tw: Toolwatch is the most convenient and easy way to measure the accuracy of your mechanical watch. Accuracy has always been the holy grail of watchmaking. Throughout the ages, watchmakers have been competing for building the most accurate and precise watch movement but the consumers do not have the tools to appreciate that effort. Now, with Toolwatch, every watch enthusiast is able to keep an eye on the accuracy of his watch(es)!
about-why-tw: Professional tools used by watchmakers are expensive (Toolwatch is free!) and heavy (Toolwatch is light!) and measure the watch in different positions (up, down, on a side etc) that do not reflect the actual way the watch is worn by its possessor. With Toolwatch, the accuracy is measured following your lifestyle. Unlike measuring by yourself, Toolwatch calculates for you the accuracy of your watch anytime and anywhere in an easy to use and reliable way.
about-works: Toolwatch synchronizes your browser with the U. S. Naval Observatory's atomic clocks cluster which produces a weighted average of several commercial atomic frequency standards. It is dominated by six active hydrogen masers, there are also a number of commercial cesium beam-tube standards in the cluster. We also account for the networking time between you and Toolwatch' servers. To put it simply, we do not use your computer clock but the most accurate atomic clock on earth to synchronize your timepieces.
generic-share: Discover the accuracy of your mechanical watch #toolwatch
signin-slogan: Fill the form below to create your account
no-watch-sub: Tap the button to make your first measure.
something-wrong-explain: You can modify the time by pressing on it or dismiss the measure with the back button.
accuracy-age-warning-contd: days old. You might want to measure it again and make sure everything is ok.
above-average: Your watch's accuracy is above average.
below-average: Your watch's accuracy is below average.
below-average-20-10: Lay the watch flat for a few hours (dial uppermost) to gain a few spds.
below-average-10-25: Put the watch vertically on the case side (crown downwards) to loose a few spds
below-average-25: Put the watch vertically on the case side (crown upwards) to loose spds.
servicing: If it doesn't help, get your watch serviced.
